text:
Trump continues to deflect accountability at every turn to try to hide his failure to prepare for the pandemic.

It wasn’t the World Health Organization, governors, or the press who waited to act & take this crisis seriously—the lack of leadership falls squarely on his shoulders.
In truth, we don’t have a health care “system.” We have a byzantine network of medical institutions dominated by the profit-making interests of insurance and drug companies.

American taxpayers put tens of millions of dollars into developing remdesivir. Any coronavirus treatment or vaccine must be made free for everybody.

We will not tolerate profiteering by Gilead or any other pharmaceutical corporation right now. RT @nytopinion If there is any silver lining in the horrible pandemic and economic collapse we’re experiencing, it is that many in our country are now beginning to rethink the basic assumptions underlying the American value system, writes @BernieSanders https://trib.al/EIrc3DE

We are committed to ensuring small businesses across America have access to the resources they need as we continue the fight against the coronavirus. #FamiliesFirst #FNS http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EV_BbSMXYAExRDR.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1251930462664167424/vid/480x270/o89P1QyOrO2BE_J5.mp4?tag=13

ADDITIONAL $ in #PPP for smaller lenders who make up 80% of #PPPloans is a deal we could have made 10 days ago

Nearly 20% of #PPPloans approved were by lenders with less than $1 billion in assets

And 60% of the loans were approved by lenders with $10 billion or less

Strong leaders take responsibility. Weak leaders don’t.

When the President continues to deflect responsibility, blame others, and promote a recovery narrative that isn’t science-based, he increases the #coronavirus threat to the lives and livelihoods of the American people. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1251977616325738496/pu/img/Pw9dAZmqwadyxpme.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1251977616325738496/pu/vid/480x270/-ZVznkG761-2-z0s.mp4?tag=10

Americans around the country agree that we need government action to help rebuild our economy—and strong guardrails to ensure taxpayer dollars aren’t just going to the wealthy and well-connected.

That’s what I’ll be pushing for in the next stimulus. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EWATQ5XWkAAUcQ1.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1252020478333550592/vid/320x320/F3DgV1At_xmc8Rk_.mp4?tag=13

In the midst of the coronavirus pandemic and the meltdown of our economy, it’s imperative that we re-examine some of the foundations of American society, understand why they are failing us, and fight for a fairer and more just nation.

Coronavirus doesn’t care about race, political party, or immigration status. Yet in the middle of a pandemic, Otay Mesa Detention Center personnel reportedly withheld face masks until immigrant detainees signed waivers.

2/2 And to all the Lefties defending California’s idiocy, skating alone poses ZERO public health threat to anybody. You want to enforce social distancing in public spaces, fine, but filling a skate park with sand—so nobody can use it—is authoritarian abuse of power.

We need to ask ourselves how it happened that we have an economy where half of our people are living paycheck to paycheck and 40% cannot afford a $400 emergency.

Leaders take responsibility. Trump said last month that anyone who wants a test for COVID-19 can get one. That's not true—there still aren’t nearly enough tests.
 
The American people need Trump to show leadership and ensure we produce the tests and supplies to adequately combat this crisis.

We can't continue along the path of greed and unfettered capitalism, in which three people own more wealth than the bottom half of Americans and tens of millions struggle to afford food, housing, and education.

We must go forward in a very new direction.
The direction of the Supreme Court is on the ballot in November.
